text: <@USRE524EA> already added idea, so let’s see how other developers thinks on this and upvotes as well <@U2H3TT8F2>

To make it visible here as well, I appreciate it if you can upvote the idea.

There have been some news about court decisions in Germany that sharpen the cookie situation (e.g., <https://www.heise.de/ct/artikel/Cookies-nur-mit-aktiver-Einwilligung-erlaubt-4783626.html> or <https://www.e-recht24.de/artikel/datenschutz/12119-bgh-urteil-cookies-einwilligung.html>). This might be also the case for other countries soon.


Users don't have the choice to select which kind of cookies they want to accept (e.g., “Necessary", “Performance” or “Marketing”). It would be great to specify the options for which we collect data from the user. It would be nice to have such a feature in HS.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Cookie-policy-banner-with-options/idi-p/353801>

It would be great if when a user fills out a form, a PDF could be emailed to the user and the contact owner with all the data from the form.

Also, as an added bonus we would love this PDF to be added to the contact ‘attachments’ automatically too.
